models.name: YOLO
models.description: YOLO, which stands for You Only Look Once, is a family of computer vision models designed for real-time object detection. Introduced in 2016 by Joseph Redmon, Santosh Divvala, Ross Girshick, and Ali Farhadi, YOLO models are known for their speed and accuracy. These models predict the position of bounding boxes and classification probabilities for objects in an image in a single pass, making them efficient for real-time applications. This models verion is YOLOv11

models.name: Segment by lightening
models.description: One of the traditional algorithm methods to segment objects. This approach uses Morphology and Thresholding that brightens the objects making them more recognisable.

models.name: Segment by darkening
models.description: One of the traditional algorithm methods to segment objects. This approach uses Morphology and Thresholding that darkens the objects making them more recognisable.

models.name: Just take the images
models.description: No model, just take a picture

models.name: Fast-SAM
models.description: Fast-SAM is a lightweight and efficient image segmentation model that provides fast, promptable segmentation using points, boxes, or masks. It offers performance comparable to SAM but with significantly lower computational requirements, making it ideal for real-time and resource-constrained applications.
